content.description: The west face of the tower hosts a crimpy little affair.  Tough moves right off the ground give way to easier terrain up high.
content.protection: Toprope setup with nuts and hexes.
content.location: West face (faces the main cliffline) of Sun Drop II Tower.  Lead or solo Burnt-Out Candle around the corner to set up a TR.

content.description: Climb the podium several feet right of Into The Sun and continue to the roof. Move left around the corner (crux) and finish on the easy climbing of Into The Sun.
content.protection: TR as for Into The Sun

content.description: Excellent route up the Arete (to the far right of Into the Sun).  Fun and pumpy! :)
content.protection: Small gear TR Setup on top of the tower
content.location: Straight up the well defined Southeast Arete

content.description: This climb isn't on sun drop tower. It's 30 steps to the north on the west wall. Not sure what that piece of rock is called?
content.protection: Cams for leading, nuts for a anchor up top.

content.description: A short route that starts on the northwest arete.
content.protection: Toprope with nuts and hexes.  Long slings not necessary.

content.description: The South face of Sun Drop II Tower.  Starts on obvious edges moving straight up the face on edges, sidepulls, gastons, a full hand pinch, and one good rest.  The route eases considerably after the first two-thirds.
content.protection: Toprope with nuts and small hexes.  Long slings not necessary
content.location: About 30 yards before the Quarry break left on a steep trail up to the cliff line, go west for about 10 yards...can't miss it.

content.description: The easiest way to the top of this feature.  Start in the dihedral and gain the big ledge.  Here you can plug in some gear to protect the 5.5 face move if you aren't soloing.  Be cautious of cranking hard on the holds near the crux since they are part of a detached block (can be seen at the bottom of the main photo.)  Easy climbing to the top.
content.protection:
Standard rack or solo. 

  Bring small pro for the crack that divides the top if you're planning to TR other routes.
content.location: Start in the dihedral with the chock stone, go up.

content.description: A square detached pillar roughly 10 feet from the main cliffline.  The side facing the cliff is about 25 feet high.  A couple of easy trad leads or solo get you up.  Topropes can be set up with nuts and hexes in a finger sized crack splitting the top of the tower.
